intro: Salvia betulifolia var. betulifolia, commonly known as the birchleaf sage, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It features slender, upright stems that produce opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces spikes of purple to violet flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value comes from its striking foliage and long-lasting blooms.
